title: Effects of an inhibitor of glycolysis set member 4

content.question: Which of the following describes why a glucose transporter is needed to move glucose into the cell?

choices.label: Glucose is nonpolar and requires <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to move across the membrane.
Glucose molecules are polar and need to move from low concentration to high concentration.
Glucose molecules are charged, and charged molecules are only ever actively transported.
Glucose is large and polar and cannot pass through the phospholipid bilayer.

content.answer: Glucose is large and polar and cannot pass through the phospholipid bilayer.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
